title: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party moves SC challenging Bihar elections, seeks fresh polls

content: The group also said that some provisions which are part of the negotiation seeks to limit, and in some cases completely block, generic competition

title: Maoist killed in encounter with security personnel in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: There has been a rise in fatalities among insurgents as the government aims to eliminate Left-Wing Extremism by the end of March

title: Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic resumes after 33 hours; overturned gas tanker removed
content: The tanker overturned on the Mumbai-bound carriageway around 5 p.m. on Tuesday (February 3, 2026), triggering a massive traffic congestion that left thousands of vehicles stranded for hours on the busy expressway

title: Allahabad HC acquits nearly 100-year-old man over four decades after he got bail in murder case
content: The murder happened in 1982 over a land dispute, and three persons, including Dhami Ram was accused in the case

title: Ambati Rambabu’s daughter alleges TDP MLA’s role in attack on house
content: TDP MLA Galla Madhavi denies allegations, says she went to Ambati Rambabu’s house to seek an apology for the latter’s derogatory remarks on CM

title: I praise India for having assumed leadership for AI Impact Summit: UN chief Guterres
content: Secretary General Guterres will be travelling to India to attend the India–AI Impact Summit 2026 that will be held on February 19-20 in New Delhi

title: YSRCP will respond firmly if ‘Jungle Raj’ continues in A.P., says Jagan
content: The State government is trying to divert public attention after lab reports exposed claims on Tirupati laddu issue, says the YSRCP president

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 7 LIVE: Rijiju slams Opposition for disturbing Rajya Sabha
content: The Prime Minister is likely to reply in the Rajya Sabha on the Motion of Thanks today as the discussion continues

title: Over 100 boxes of explosives seized from pick-up van in Kerala's Palakkad
content: Police say over 100 boxes of gelatin sticks and more than 20 boxes of detonators found in the vehicle. The boxes were hidden under a consignment of watermelons

title: New session of Manipur assembly to begin on February 5
content: Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla has summoned the seventh session of the 12th Manipur Legislative Assembly at 4 p.m.

title: Man who tried to shoot Trump at Florida golf course gets life in prison
content: U.S. District Judge Aileen Cannon pronounced Ryan Routh's fate in the same Fort Pierce courtroom that erupted into chaos in September when he tried to stab himself shortly after jurors found him guilty on all counts

title: Odisha govt’s pending telephone bills run into crores
content: Union Minister Jyotiraditya M. Scindia shot off three reminders in recent months requesting Odisha government to clear dues of BSNL which is under financial stress

title: First English medium playschool in Rajasthan village set to benefit rural children
content: The playschool has been opened at Shaheed Suresh Singh Government Senior Secondary School in Lambi-Sahad, under Lambi-Ahir village panchayat, with transportation facility and inclusive access

title: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal’s statement on trade deal is a no-statement, says Congress
content: High-sounding claims go completely contrary to what the U.S. President, the U.S. Secretary of Agriculture, and the U.S. Trade Representative have put out, says Jairam Ramesh

title: Privileges Committee toprobe Punjab Police role in ‘doctored’ video row
content: Speaker has concluded prima facie case of breach of privilege exists after examining police force’s reply: Secretariat; panel directed to submit detailed report in accordance with Rules of Procedure

title: U.K. asks Air India to explain Boeing Dreamliner fuel-switch incident
content: The U.K. Civil Aviation Authority warned of the possibility of regulatory action against Air India and its Boeing 787 fleet if the airline does not submit a complete response ​within a week

title: Yatnal alleges bias in Karnataka BJP’s fight against corruption
content: Referring to the protest seeking resignation of Excise Minister R.B. Thimmapur over alleged corruption, he maintained that BJP should have shown a similar approach with respect to alleged corruption by other Ministers

title: Centre gives a pittance to T.N. despite State ranking 2nd on economic front: CM Stalin
content: Tamil Nadu is the most urbanised State and has the most number of industries, Stalin says, adding that it is one of the major contributors of tax revenue and works hard for country’s development.

title: DVAC assures court of proper probe into ED’s plaint against T.N. Minister Nehru’s department
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan reserve orders on two writ petitions insisting upon registration of a FIR

title: Andre Beteille: A sociologist with rigorous scholarship who laid emphasis on importance of fieldwork
content: Former colleagues and students recall his steadfast commitment to teaching at Delhi School of Economics, rigorous scholarship

title: Fake currency racket busted, four arrested in Andhra
content: The accused were printing counterfeit currency notes in Visakhapatnam district and circulating them in different places, say police

title: In his maiden speech at Rajya Sabha, Kamal Haasan calls SIR a ‘disease giving rise to many living dead’
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, referring to Mr. Hassan’s statement alleging that she had used derogatory words about the Tamil language in 2025, clarified that she had quoted Periyar E.V. Ramasamy Naicker and it was not her views.

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Theft case against Ajith Kumar closed, CBI tells Madurai Bench of Madras High Court
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation closed the alleged theft of jewellery case as there was no evidence and no materials

title: Dramatic protests in Lok Sabha prevent PM’s reply to the motion of thanks
content: Congress says PM should give his reply only after LoP gets to speak; Congress MPs protest BJP MP’s “disruptive” reading from books making allegations against Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi

title: FICCI Ladies Organisation opens 50-acre industrial park for women entrepreneurs in Gauribidanur in Karnataka
content: This 50-acre infrastructure aims to lower long-standing entry barriers that have historically kept women, especially first-generation entrepreneurs, out of manufacturing and largescale enterprise

title: Karnataka to roll out automated land mutation system Statewide
content: Mutations will be cleared automatically if no objections are raised within the stipulated notice period

title: Trinamool Congress, BJP engage in war of words in Rajya Sabha
content: From the State government’s alleged indifference toward Centrally sponsored schemes to road markings being painted in the TMC’s colours of white and blue instead of the universal yellow and black, the BJP and TMC traded charges in the Upper House

title: A ‘mischievous’ case filed against Minister Palanivel Thiaga Rajan, Madras High Court told
content: The case filed by a resident of Madurai accuses the Minister of having abused his position for unlawful gain with respect to a 2.26 acre land in Kodikulam village

title: Ladakh leaders press for Statehood; talks with Home Ministry remain inconclusive
content: The October 22, 2025 draft proposal submitted by the group regarding Statehood and inclusion of Ladakh under the sixth schedule of the Constitution, thus giving it a tribal status, was discussed at the meeting

title: Indian cities could see far higher temperature rise than projected, says study
content: This means global warming is set to hit smaller Indian cities much harder than previously predicted; in Patiala, for instance, temperatures could rise at double the rate projected for surrounding rural areas

title: Piyush Goyal lost moral authority to continue as Minister, says Samyukt Kisan Morcha
content: The Union Commerce Minister’s statement in Parliament contradicts the claims of U.S. Secretary for Agriculture, says the farmers’ body

title: Assets worth ₹27.83 crore to be seized for FEMA violations
content: Kapil Aggarwal and Ms. Sangeeta Aggarwal ‘acquired and held 10 immovable properties in Dubai for a total consideration of AED 1,94,03,975’, the agency alleged

title: Supreme Court asks if Centre can reconsider Sonam Wangchuk’s detention on health grounds
content: The Additional Solicitor General submitted that the climate activist had made provocative speeches, which had led to violence in Leh in 2025

title: PM Modi to discuss ties during two-day visit to Malaysia
content: The PM will hold discussions with Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim and representatives of Indian community in Kuala Lumpur

title: Litigants can directly approach High Court if police station ‘rejects’ complainant, says Karnataka HC
content: The court says the procedure of approaching a superior officer and the Magistrate applies exclusively to cases of ‘refusal’ to record information and does not extend to cases of “rejection” of a complaint by a reasoned endorsement

title: Mamata Banerjee’s visit to Supreme Court was part of ‘scripted drama’: BJP
content: Mamata trying to derail SIR, influence votes based on 2024 voter lists, claims BJP LoP in State Assembly; State BJP chief says Trinamool compelled BLOs to upload false documents in the system

title: Victims recall horrific ordeal during communal violence in Chhattisgarh’s Gariaband
content: A large mob allegedly unleashed itself on the 10-odd Muslim families of Dutkaiya village, setting their houses on fire and forcing them to flee

title: Trinamool Congress hails Mamata Banerjee’s Supreme Court appearance as ‘big win’
content: From Ministers in the West Bengal government, to party MPs and spokesperson, several leaders of Trinamool Congress lauded the efforts of the party chairperson of arguing against SIR before the Supreme Court

title: West Kochi continues to experience acute water shortage
content: In Fort Kochi alone, tanker lorries have to be used to supply water in certain pockets every alternate day

title: CCI probes IndiGo for dominance abuse, fare hikes after December flight cancellations
content: Probe report to be submitted in 90 days; order after passenger complained of buying air tickets at double the price after IndiGo cancelled his flight

title: Every single genuine person must remain on electoral roll, CJI tells West Bengal CM in Supreme Court
content: Assuring CM Mamata Banerjee, the top Court said that the Election Commission of India cannot “run away” from its Constitutional obligation to ensure that “every single genuine citizen” is included in the electoral

title: Forest department uses tech to track tiger, ropes in Pune-based experts to tranquilise it
content: At least 100 forest department personnel are monitoring the movements of the tiger 24x7, apart from the deployment of the state-of-the-art technology to tranquilize it.

title: Civic poll campaign shifts to top gear in TG
content: CM A. Revanth Reddy launches campaign from Miryalaguda, BJP national president Nitin Nabin kick-starts poll campaign from Mahabubnagar

title: Kerala to fund ₹1,900 crore for Sabari rail project
content: Cabinet decides that the State will bear 50% of the cost of the Angamaly–Erumely Sabari Railway Project and raise its share through the Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board. The project — first proposed in the 1997-98 Railway Budget — has finally been set in motion after a hiatus of nearly three decades.

title: Namma Metro fares in Bengaluru set to rise by 5% from February 9
content: The decision follows the implementation of the annual fare adjustment recommended by the Fare Fixation Committee (FFC)

title: Water crisis threatens paddy fields in various panchayats in Thrissur; farmers warn of mass protests against KSEB
content: Farming in Kannukettichira–Vazhikkilichira polder worst affected. Ryots allege that crisis is triggered by KSEB’s failure in releasing water from its dams to irrigation system and warn of mass protest against the power utility

title: Tiger made eight cattle kills over three weeks in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district
content: A special committee has been constituted to monitor the tiger’s movements and take decisions on the course of action to be adopted by the Forest department

title: NBA trade buzz: Live updates and intel during deadline week
content: Kristaps Porzingis is headed to the Warriors, and Giannis is not. Catch up on what we're hearing from insiders.

title: Sources: Dubs deal Kuminga, Hield for Porzingis
content: The Warriors are trading Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield to the Hawks for Kristaps Porzingis, sources told ESPN, unofficially putting an end to Golden State's pursuit of Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: Sources: Tigers land Valdez for 3 years, $115M
content: Framber Valdez and the Tigers are in agreement on a three-year, $115 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan, the highest average annual value ever for a left-handed pitcher.

title: NCAA denies appeal for Ole Miss QB Chambliss
content: The NCAA has denied Ole Miss' appeal for Trinidad Chambliss' sixth-year eligibility waiver, which will direct his fight to play college football in 2026 to state court.

title: Sources: Mavs overhaul again, trade AD to Wiz
content: The Mavericks are trading 10-time All-Star Anthony Davis to the Wizards as part of an eight-player trade, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Sources: Lonzo to become free agent after trade
content: The Jazz have acquired Lonzo Ball in a three-team trade with the Cavaliers and Hawks but are expected to waive the veteran guard and allow him to become a free agent, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Paul lands with Raptors in 3-team trade
content: Chris Paul, a 12-time NBA All-Star, has landed with the Raptors amid a three-team trade involving the Clippers and the Nets, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Izzo threatens to bench Fears after critical tech
content: Michigan State head coach Tom Izzo called out star guard Jeremy Fears after he was accused of employ dirty tactics for the second straight game, this time earning a critical technical foul in a 76-73 loss to Minnesota.

title: Huskies' Williams got 'bad advice' on near transfer
content: Washington quarterback Demond Williams Jr. said Wednesday his short-lived decision to leave the Huskies was a mistake that resulted from "really bad advice."

title: Grading every NBA trade: Which teams have fared best?
content: The Cavaliers, Celtics, Hawks, Mavericks and Warriors are among the teams that have made trades. We're grading every deal.

title: Who you calling old? At the 2026 Olympics, age is just a number
content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

content: Laila Edwards, a standout at Wisconsin, is ready for her Olympic debut as USA Hockey's first Black player.

content: Find out what Sam Darnold, Drake Maye, Cooper Kupp, TreVeyon Henderson and others were like before the NFL.

content: Will the Seahawks or Patriots win? Who will be the MVP? Our analysts and reporters make their predictions.

content: For the first time, a $1 million base salary is expected in the new WNBA CBA, and the cap could see a 230% increase.

content: Which players are under the most pressure and where all 30 teams rank a day before the Thursday trade deadline.

content: Ali Barat is impossible to miss -- last summer's transfer window was dominated by his clients making big moves -- yet hard to track down. It's all part of his mystique.

content: Man City's win in the Carabao Cup semis sets the stage for a final vs. Arsenal, and a potentially thrilling end to the season.

content: Abdul Carter to the Jets? Tyler Shough to the Browns? Emeka Egbuka to the 49ers? We repicked the first two rounds of last year's NFL draft.

content: In a sprint to the early signing period, Franklin gutted his former school and brought life to the Hokies.

content: With signing day closing many team's personnel moves, we look at the teams ready to make long postseason runs.

content: The fourth stop of the PGA Tour season brings us to Scottsdale, where we can expect to see plenty of birdies at the WM Phoenix Open.

title: Super Bowl LX expected to see highest ticket price since 2020
content: Vivid Seats projects the crowd split in Santa Clara on Sunday will be a 61-39 advantage toward Seahawks fans.

content: From pregame style to fashion week, NFL fashion editor Kyle Smith helps players level up their style.

title: Ghostbusters: Back Darnold, Seahawks to exorcise some demons in Super Bowl LX
content: Liz Loza advises not to underestimate the revenge factor as Sam Darnold and the Seahawks face their New England demons in the Super Bowl

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Bayern midfielder Goretzka
content: Could Arsenal improve their midfield by signing Leon Goretzka from Bayern Munich? Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Real Madrid's big transfer questions: What to do about Vini Jr., more
content: January transfer window was quiet, but there are plenty of issues for the club to address in the summer.

content: A look around the league reveals the latest trends, from Victor Wembanyama's minute restriction to Karl-Anthony Towns' changing offensive role, and more.

title: From Harden and JJJ to Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to the trade deadline.

title: 'Fired In Middle Of War Zone': Washington Post's Ukraine Correspondent Laid Off
content: The Washington Post's Ukraine correspondent has announced that she was laid off by the billionaire Jeff Bezos-owned newspaper "in the middle of a war zone."

title: Musk Vows To Run Data Centers In Space On Solar Power But Experts Have Doubts
content: Elon Musk said he wants to put as many as a million satellites into orbit to form vast, solar-powered data centers in space.

title: Who Is Pranshu Verma, Washington Post New Delhi Bureau Chief, Now Laid Off
content: The layoffs have hit The Washington Post's international coverage particularly hard, with large portions of its foreign staff affected.

title: AI To Track Icebergs Adrift At Sea In Boon For Science
content: British scientists said that a world-first AI tool to catalogue and track icebergs as they break apart into smaller chunks could fill a "major blind spot" in predicting climate change.

title: Dozens Of Goats Bitten On Neck By Men, Bleed Out In Telangana Sacrifice
content: A shocking case of animal cruelty has emerged from Telangana. In Jagtial district, the method of animal sacrifice caused an immense uproar at a religious event on Tuesday during the Bhimanna Jatra festival.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 4 Live: Motion Of Thanks Passed By Voice Vote In Lok Sabha
content: Parliament Budget Session2026 Day 4 Live Updates: The Opposition parties will hold a key meet at Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge's office at 10 am.

title: Honeymoon Murder 2.0: Out On Walk, Man Dies In Hit-And-Run Planned By Wife
content: Ashish and Anju, a newlywed couple from Rajasthan, were out on a walk when a vehicle hit them. While Ashish died on the spot, Anju was robbed of her gold jewellery and left unconscious on the road.

title: Ghaziabad Triple Suicide Updates: Chilling New Details In Ghaziabad Sisters' Suicide Over 'Korean Love'
content: The three minor sisters who allegedly jumped to their deaths from a ninth-floor flat in Ghaziabad on Wednesday left a diary with an eight-page note detailing their love for Korea and K-Pop.

title: Opinion: Opinion | A 'Greater Balochistan'? Why This New Threat Has Pakistan Losing Its Sleep
content: Operation Herof 2 and the larger Baloch uprising are no longer being seen as a local separatist movement but as part of a larger global conspiracy to cut not just Iran but also Pakistan to size.

title: "New Delhi Is Free...": Moscow On India Stopping Russia Oil Trade Under US Deal
content: Russia said India is free to buy oil from any country after US President Donald Trump claimed India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil as part of the trade deal between New Delhi and Washington signed earlier this week.

title: "You're Indian, We're Korean": Chilling Details From Diary In Ghaziabad Deaths
content: The diary left behind by the girls in the Ghaziabad triple suicide case points to an acute obsession with Korea and Korean culture in what is believed to have culminated in a tragic end, triggered allegedly by a task-based game.

title: Karnataka Pan Shop Owner Beaten To Death Over Payment Dispute
content: A petty dispute over the payment for cigarettes and water bottles turned deadly in a Karnataka village, where a 48-year-old pan shop owner was brutally assaulted and killed by a group of men.

title: Video: Delhi Man Thrashed By 4 For Trying To Stop Woman's Harassment
content: A 35-year-old man was thrashed on Wednesday by four men after he intervened to stop an alleged eve-teasing of a woman in south Delhi's Saket area, an official said.

title: Gold Down To Rs 1.5 Lakh, Silver Loses Rs 16,000: Check Prices In Your City Today
content: Gold and silver prices continued to show sharp fluctuations on the Multi-Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Thursday, leaving investors, traders, and buyers on edge.

title: Google's Annual Revenue Tops $400 Billion For First Time, AI Investments Rise
content: Google parent Alphabet reported blockbuster earnings, its revenue climbing as it invests massively in cloud computing services enhanced with artificial intelligence.

title: Trump Suggests 'Softer Touch' Needed On Immigration
content: US President Donald Trump suggested that a "softer touch" may be needed on immigration, as his administration said 700 federal officers would be pulled from Minnesota but that mass deportations would not stop.

title: "Russia Oil Sanctions Not By UN": Top Economist To NDTV On Trump's India-US Deal Claim
content: Economist, United Nations advisor, and Columbia University professor Jeffrey Sachs believes that the announcement of the India-US trade deal is a sign of US President Donald Trump backing down from his trade wars all over the world.

title: Andrew Moves To King Charles III's Private Estate After Epstein Document Uproar
content: The former Prince Andrew has moved out of his longtime home on crown-owned land near Windsor Castle earlier than expected after the latest release of documents from the US investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Ghaziabad Sisters Had Social Media Account With Korean Names, Big Following
content: The three sisters - Nishika (16), Prachi (14), and Pakhi (12) - had created a social media account that gained a significant number of followers. They identified themselves with Korean names.

title: Nike Faces Federal Probe Over Allegations Of Discrimination Against White Workers
content: The federal agency for protecting workers' civil rights revealed Wednesday that it is investigating sportswear giant Nike for allegedly discriminating against white employees through its diversity policies.

title: Kids, elderly and patients left stuck for 32 hours on Pune–Mumbai Expressway
content: A tanker carrying flammable propylene overturned on the Pune-Mumbai expressway, causing a 32-hour traffic disruption. Thousands of commuters, including patients and senior citizens, faced a harrowing ordeal with no food or water. Rescue operations and gas transfer caused significant delays, impacting transport services.

title: Man kicked, punched, beaten in Delhi for objecting to harassment of women
content: A 26-year-old businessman was brutally assaulted in south Delhi's Mehrauli after he intervened to stop four men from harassing three women. The attackers beat him severely, even after he lost consciousness. Police have arrested all four accused, who have been charged under various sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Specialists back in vogue: India’s team management takes a U-turn ahead of T20 WC
content: MS Dhoni's rare praise highlights India's formidable T20 World Cup squad, deemed 'one of the most dangerous teams.' A ruthless selection process and strategic pivots, particularly under coach Gautam Gambhir, have forged an immaculately balanced unit. With aggression as the core principle and specialists in key roles, Team India appears stronger than ever, poised to dominate.

title: Birthday balloons explode inside lift in Mumbai’s Goregaon
content: A young student, Himani Tapriya, sustained severe burns after dozens of gas-filled balloons exploded in a lift at Amol Tower, Goregaon. The incident occurred when a delivery man, Raju Kumar Mahato, entered the lift with the balloons. Police have registered a negligence case against the shop owner for failing to provide safety instructions to his employee, who also suffered injuries.

title: Google crosses $400 billion revenue mark for the first time; Elon Musk reacts
content: Google achieved a historic milestone, surpassing $400 billion in annual revenue for the first time in its Q4 2025 earnings report. CEO Sundar Pichai highlighted strong momentum across Google Services and Google Cloud, with AI advancements like Gemini driving significant growth and user engagement. The company anticipates substantial capital expenditures for 2026 to meet escalating customer demand.

title: Mahindra's massive Make In India push: 35,000 Scorpio Pik-Ups to be exported to Indonesia
content: Under this partnership, Mahindra and Agrinas Pangan Nusantara aim to equip Koperasi with robust, reliable vehicles to ensure the effective, seamless flow of fresh supplies from farmers directly to the marketplace, thereby bridging the gap between producers and consumers.

title: Fourth-time lucky for Delhi? Jemimah set for key role as Mandhana’s RCB await WPL final
content: Jemimah Rodrigues has transformed into a commanding Delhi Capitals captain, leading her team to the WPL final after a shaky start.  Despite RCB's league-stage dominance and final experience, the Capitals, with their in-form batting unit and resilient captain, arrive with significant momentum for the summit showdown.

title: India-US trade deal: What it means for economy, markets & Russian oil imports?
content: India and the US have announced a framework for a bilateral trade deal to strengthen trade ties, under which the US will cut tariffs on Indian goods to 18% from 50%. The Centre has clarified that agriculture and dairy remain protected, while sectors such as textiles, leather and gems may benefit.

title: Explained: What is Anthropic's AI tool that wiped $285 billion off software stocks in a single day
content: A swift market reaction, dubbed 'SaaSpocalypse,' saw software stocks plummet by $285 billion after Anthropic's AI assistant, Claude Cowork, launched new plugins.  The legal workflow automation plugin, in particular, triggered a selloff in legal tech and broader software sectors. Analysts now fear AI platforms are becoming direct competitors to existing software providers.

title: 'Had to leave my marriage': Melinda hints at Bill Gates’ Epstein link as reason for divorce
content: Melinda French Gates expressed deep sadness and exhaustion over newly released Epstein files that resurfaced painful memories from her marriage to Bill Gates. She emphasized her heartbreak for the victims and stated that her ex-husband and others involved need to answer for their actions, not her.

title: Gurgaon shocker: Class 8 student raped, impregnated by neighbour
content: In a shocking incident in Gurgaon, a 14-year-old girl fell victim to a horrific crime when she was allegedly raped by her 19-year-old neighbor. The sad story unfolded in January after the young victim reported excruciating pain, prompting a visit to the doctor, who revealed she was two weeks pregnant.

title: Drunk techie strips naked outside Bangalore Club, blocks car, fights cops
content: A US-based techie, Rajesh Anant, was denied entry to the Bangalore Club for being unaccompanied and inebriated. He later returned naked, blocked a car, and fought with security and police, leading to his father's one-month club suspension and his own ban.

title: Anthropic makes Super Bowl ad debut, and the target of '30-second spot' is Sam Altman
content: AI startup Anthropic debuted a Super Bowl ad mocking OpenAI's planned ChatGPT ads. The commercial humorously depicted AI conversations being interrupted by product pitches, emphasizing Claude's ad-free experience. This move signals a shift in AI marketing towards competitive positioning, highlighting Anthropic's commitment to uninterrupted AI interactions.

title: No school since Covid: Ghaziabad sisters stayed away from society play areas too
content: Three sisters died by suicide after years of isolation, with their lives consumed by K-pop and Korean dramas as an escape from parental disapproval and family stress. A recovered diary revealed deep resentment over perceived unfair objections to their interests and accusations of physical punishment, highlighting a tragic convergence of isolation and unmet emotional needs.

title: What is new in UPSC CSE 2026? No second chance for serving officers
content: The Union Public Service Commission has tightened rules for the Civil Services Examination 2026. Serving IAS and IFS officers cannot reappear. IPS officers can only compete for other services. A one-time improvement chance is available for those allocated in 2026 or earlier. Resignation is mandatory for further attempts after this window.

title: Gold, silver price prediction: Precious metals on track for gains? Here's the outlook
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold and silver prices have resumed their upward momentum after the recent crash, signalling bullish momentum, says Abhilash Koikkara, Head - Forex & Commodities, Nuvama Professional Clients Group. He shares his views on gold and silver:

title: ‘Korea was life’: Ghaziabad girls had rift with father over K-pop before deaths
content: In a heart-wrenching incident in Ghaziabad, the lives of three young sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, ended tragically as they fell from their ninth-floor apartment. Eyewitnesses recounted seeing the eldest sister plunge first, with her younger siblings following shortly after.

title: IND vs SA warm-up: Ishan settles opener debate; Surya & Co. on the loose
content: Ishan Kishan’s explosive warm-up knock against South Africa may have finally settled India’s long-running wicketkeeper debate. With Sanju Samson out of form and the World Cup around the corner, Kishan’s clarity, confidence, and dominance at the top make him the clear frontrunner. And come Saturday, he will walk out as Abhishek Sharma's opening partner against the USA in Mumbai.

title: 'During COVID, she kicked me out of the house’: R Madhavan on how Sarita pushed him back to work
content: R Madhavan recently shared a candid and humorous anecdote about how his wife Sarita played a key role in pushing him back into work during the pandemic. What began as a light-hearted nudge eventually became a turning point, helping the actor reassess his mindset, reset after a four-year break from acting, and return with renewed focus—especially towards projects that genuinely excited him, including a steady shift to OTT platforms.

title: 'Gavu Pattadam': Men bite goats, leave them to die in ritual sacrifice during Jagtial temple jatara
content: A brutal animal sacrifice involving around 50 goats, killed by biting their throats, has been reported from Jagtial district during the Bheemanna Jatara. Animal rights activists recorded the disturbing ritual, leading to an FIR against organizers under multiple acts. Despite being illegal, such sacrifices persist, with locals citing tradition and belief in wish fulfillment.

title: London-Bengaluru Fuel Switch Issue: UK regulator seeks Air India details; NGO flags probe risk
content: The UK's aviation regulator has requested information from Air India regarding maintenance on a Boeing 787 after a fuel control switch issue was reported in London. While Air India conducted precautionary checks and found no further issues, an NGO has lodged a complaint, urging the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau to secure evidence and maintain its independence.

title: Rupee inches 7 paise to reach 90.40 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee opened marginally higher at 90.45 against the US dollar on Thursday, recovering slightly after a dip in the previous session. Mixed market sentiment prevails as traders await official confirmation of the India-US trade deal, with crude oil price volatility also influencing currency movements.

title: Ramadan 2026 in the UAE: Working hours, penalties and rules explained
content: UAE residents and workers are excited for Ramadan 2026, with mandatory reduced working hours for private and government sectors. Employees can expect at least two fewer hours daily in private firms, while government offices will operate from 9 am to 2:30 pm on weekdays. These adjustments aim to balance work with fasting and spiritual observance.

title: Panneerselvam sparks row with ‘North Indians clean tables’ in Tamil Nadu remark; BJP hits back
content: The BJP has strongly criticised a Tamil Nadu minister's remarks about North Indian migrant workers, calling them derogatory and part of a pattern by the ruling DMK to fuel social divisions. The party highlighted the minister's comments about migrants working in low-paying jobs and questioned the silence of opposition alliance leaders, deeming such statements dangerous amidst rising violence against workers.

title: Should Iran's supreme leader Khamenei be worried? Trump's response and a blunt warning
content: President Trump issued a stern warning to Iran against restarting its nuclear program, threatening severe consequences if new facilities are established. He claimed US strikes had previously destroyed targeted nuclear sites, preventing Iran from accessing them and asserting that the country was close to developing a nuclear weapon.

title: Injury scare for India before T20 WC as pacer limps off during warm-up clash
content: Team India faces a worrying injury blow as pacer Harshit Rana limped off during a T20 World Cup warm-up against South Africa. This adds to concerns over Washington Sundar's fitness just before the tournament begins. Despite this, Tilak Varma impressed with an all-round performance, and India secured a 30-run victory.

title: Woman detained for abusing Greater Noida condo residents over walking pet dog
content: A Greater Noida woman was detained by police after a pet dog allegedly defecated in a common area, sparking a heated argument. Residents claim the owner used abusive language when confronted about designated pet zones. A viral video of the confrontation led to a formal complaint and the woman's questioning by Bisrakh police, who stated legal action would follow.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 150 points
content: Indian stock markets opened lower today, with Nifty50 and BSE Sensex experiencing declines. While IT stocks faced a sell-off due to automation fears, domestic consumption-driven sectors showed resilience. Analysts remain cautiously optimistic, awaiting FII buying trends and positive impacts from recent trade deals and budget announcements.

title: Watch: Night of horror for Philippines as devastating fire leaves thousands homeless
content: A devastating fire ravaged Bongao, southern Philippines, destroying over 1,000 homes and leaving thousands homeless. Fueled by strong winds and flammable materials, the blaze spread rapidly, forcing residents to flee by land and sea. Authorities are investigating the cause of the fire, which caused an estimated 17.5 million Philippine pesos in property damage.

title: UGC NET December 2025 result declared: Details to check scorecard
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced the UGC NET December 2025 results and the final answer key on its official website. Candidates can now download their scorecards, which indicate their eligibility for Junior Research Fellowship, Assistant Professor positions, and PhD admissions. The results are based on the final answer key, released after reviewing candidate objections.

title: Delhi pro-Khalistan graffiti case: 2 arrested; plot traced to Canada, SFJ angle probed
content: Delhi Police Special Cell has arrested two individuals, an ambulance driver and his associate, for allegedly writing pro-Khalistan slogans in the capital ahead of Republic Day. The duo reportedly acted on instructions from Canada, with a close associate of SFJ founder Gurpatwant Singh Pannun allegedly hiring them for ₹2 lakh.

title: ‘Wanted to open’: Ishan Kishan’s fearless 50 dents Sanju Samson’s WC hopes
content: Ishan Kishan's explosive 53 powered India to a 30-run victory over South Africa in a T20 World Cup warm-up in Mumbai. Kishan, eager to open, showcased his aggressive intent, setting a strong tone. The team's batting order experimented, with Kishan and Abhishek Sharma opening. India's bowlers also delivered, restricting South Africa.

title: T20 WC: More power, more depth; why India's 2026 squad outshines 2024
content: India enters the T20 World Cup with a confident and settled squad, building on their 2024 title-winning approach.  With a blend of experienced players and new talent like Abhishek Sharma, the team is poised for success, though batting order and conditions pose potential challenges.

title: ‘CM gives provocative speeches’: EC urges SC to step in; flags threat to Bengal staff on SIR duty
content: Comparing smooth conduct of SIR in other states to that in Bengal where those involved in the roll revision have been “targeted”, EC, in its affidavit, said, “It unequivocally illustrates that the challenges encountered in West Bengal are not intrinsic to the SIR process itself, but are a direct result of the inadequacies of the state machinery and the prevailing climate of political interference therein.”

title: Energy security of 1.4bn Indians govt’s supreme priority: Goyal in Parliament
content: ​​On choice of oil suppliers, Piyush Goyal said “Diversifying our energy sourcing in keeping with objective market conditions and evolving international dynamics is at the core of our strategy to ensure this. All of India’s actions are taken with this in mind.” The remark stood out against the backdrop of US President Donald Trump’s claims that India had decided to stop the purchase of Russian oil to secure a trade deal.

title: Mumbai–Pune Expressway Snarl Forces Industrialist to Take Helicopter
content: A 32-hour traffic jam on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, caused by a gas tanker accident, left thousands stranded. Industrialist Dr. Sudhir Mehta, stuck for eight hours, resorted to a helicopter to return to Pune. He highlighted the need for emergency helipads and criticized the deteriorating condition of the highway, calling it a dangerous gamble.

title: NBA trade news: Miami Heat eyes Giannis and Ja without giving up Adebayo or Powell
content: Miami Heat is reportedly exploring a bold move to acquire both Giannis Antetokounmpo and Ja Morant before the trade deadline. The ambitious plan aims to secure the superstars without sacrificing key players like Bam Adebayo and Norman Powell.  This potential blockbuster trade, if successful, would significantly reshape the league's landscape.

title: Kayla Nicole opens up on emotional toll of dating Travis Kelce amid Taylor Swift
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are trying to stay out of the spotlight as they plan their future together while dealing with retirement rumors and legal trouble. Amid all the mess, Travis Kelce's ex girlfriend, Kayla Nicole's, controversial comments about what she went through while dating him has resurfaced amid her recent actions of trying to shade his relationship with Taylor Swift.

title: Red Wings target MacKenzie Weegar and Nazem Kadri in potential trade deal
content: The Detroit Red Wings have established themselves as major trade contenders before the NHL trade freeze, while Darren Dreger links them to Calgary Flames veterans MacKenzie Weegar and Nazem Kadri. The Detroit Red Wings target players who have remaining contract time because they possess enough salary cap space and prospect assets to execute a major trade deal while pursuing playoff success.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: According to Aakash K Hindocha, Deputy Vice President - WM Research, Nuvama Professional Clients Group, the top buy calls for today are: Petronet, MRPL, and CCL. Here’s his view on Nifty, Bank Nifty, and the top stock picks for February 5, 2026:

title: WPL final: Rodrigues-led DC desperate to break jinx; RCB eye another crown
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru face Delhi Capitals in the Women's Premier League final. Smriti Mandhana's RCB seeks a second title, matching Mumbai Indians. Delhi Capitals, led by Jemimah Rodrigues, aims for their first championship after three runner-up finishes. Both teams have seen key player contributions throughout the season.

title: Vivek Oberoi moves to court for protection of his personality rights
content: Actor Vivek Oberoi has filed a lawsuit in the Delhi High Court seeking legal protection for his personality rights against unauthorized use of his name, image, and voice across digital platforms. The plea aims to prevent impersonation, the sale of unlicensed merchandise, and the creation of AI-generated content, including deepfakes, that exploit his identity.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Benoit Saint Denis, Mauricio Ruffy rise at lightweight
content: Saturday's UFC 325 was headlined by a meeting between the No. 1-ranked featherweight, champion  Alexander Volkanovski , and No. 2  Diego Lopes , a fight won by the champ. But it was one weight class heavier where the fight card impacted the ESPN divisional MMA rankings. Lightweight  Benoît Saint Denis  knocked out  Dan Hooker  in the co-main event to move up three spots to No. 7. And in the fight right before that,  Mauricio Ruffy  scored a knockout of  Rafael Fiziev  to earn a place in the top 10. Those were the only changes in the rankings. Here are the  ESPN pound-for-pound MMA rankings  and a  list of current UFC champions  in all weight classes. Results are current; rankings as of Feb. 3. To be eligible for the rankings, a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or must have an upcoming fight booked. Fighters who have been dropped for inactivity can be reinstated only after they compete.

title: NASA satellite image captures frozen Hudson River through New York City
content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Consider us your scientific companion, delivering a daily dose of wonder and enlightenment. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds. Join us as we craft knowledge with precision and passion, bringing you on a journey where the mysteries of the universe unfold with every word. Read More

content: the super bowl squares pool is one of the most popular games . we have you covered for super Bowl LX between the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots . you can draw numbers out of a hat, use a deck of cards or a random number generator .

title: An epic Rookie of the Year race? 2026 predictions for MLB's top prospects
content: Kiley McDaniel has ranked the best prospects and farm systems in baseball ahead of the 2026 MLB season . the list includes Caden Scarborough, who will be a fixture in the Tigers' every-day lineup by the end of the season.

title: NHL trade grades: Who comes out ahead in Artemi Panarin trade?
content: the 2025-26 NHL trade season is off to a busy start . the Vancouver Canucks traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights . earlier, the Pittsburgh Penguins sent goaltender Tristan Jarry and forward Sam Poulin to the Edmonton Oilers .

title: Projecting Rounds 1-2 of the draft: Landing spots for 11 Senior Bowl standouts
content: a mock draft of 2026 draft starts April 23 in Pittsburgh . more than 100 prospects from the Senior Bowl will join hundreds of others at the combine . the draft will shuffle draft boards, and free agency next month will alter needs of each team .

title: Ryan Preece overcomes sleet, cautions to win The Clash
content: sleet, a wet track and a record number of cautions to win The Clash . the event had originally been scheduled for Sunday but was twice postponed because of snow that blanketed the state .

title: ✨ Top 10 MLB prospect rankings for every team
content: the top 10 prospects for all 30 major league farm systems are listed below . players in the big leagues are eligible for this update as MLB rookie eligibility rules apply here . there are 130 at-bats, 50 innings pitched or 45 days on the active roster .

title: AD is a Wizard?! Grading the trade and who came out on top
content: the era is over in Dallas barely a year after the Mavericks traded Luka Doncic to the los Angeles Lakers for a package headlined by the 10-time All-Star . this trade sheds the remaining $120 million on Davis' contract and brings in some late first-round picks .

title: IIT-Bombay student dies by suicide: ‘Masti, engineering & fun’ was his last Instagram caption
content: police say the student was under treatment for depression . sources say his father was hospitalised for a heart ailment in his hometown . police say this was the second incident of a student jumping to death from a hr .
